intro: Corydalis wilfordi var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves and has a creeping growth habit, often forming dense mats. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms and foliage.
